comment._content: This is now owned by the National Trust and can be visited by the public.

comment.author: 48195024@N08
comment._content: Technically this building has all ways been outside the boundaries of Bristol,it is situated betweeb Failand and Clevedon,if you have the chance to visit,do so,as it is an impressive building

comment.author: 73359068@N00
comment._content: Interesting and I think fairly rare clear view of the front before Henry Woodyer's alterations of 1887-90. He added a shallow projection left of hte porch (see note on the photo) containing three bay windows in a row instead of the one here, to light the enlarged dining room. He also made matching windows directly above.
